sourceMeaningMnemonic: A <radical>cow</radical> in the <radical>winter</radical> doesn't like to leave the barn to go to the <kanji>pasture</kanji>. It has to, though, because a cow's gotta eat.
meaningInfo: It's cold outside (it's winter after all). Imagine you having to herd all the cows out to pasture even though they don't want to leave the warm barn.
readingMnemonic: <ja>ぼく</ja> is one of the common ways to say "I" in Japanese (which you should remember!). In this case, you're a boy... a cowboy, and you say, "<ja><reading>ぼく</reading></ja> will take these cows out to pasture!"
readingInfo: Actually say that phrase out loud while thinking about bringing your cows to pasture.
